intro: Salvia mucidistachys, commonly known as the sticky stamen sage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of vibrant violet to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant produces small, two-lipped flowers with showy, glandular hairs that give it a sticky texture.
